thread.title: Arsenal news: Gunners in some of the best form in their history, stats show | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Gunners in some of the best form in their history, stats show | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Gunners in some of the best form in their history, stats show | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 8:35 am Arsene Wenger isn’t doing as bad a job as it seems (Picture: Getty) 
Everyone’s pretty much agreed that Arsenal are in decline; that they’re going backwards under Arsene Wenger – or at best, staying still. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
But stats looking at the Gunners’ win percentage in recent seasons show they’re actually in some of the best form in their history – so what on earth has gone wrong? 
It’s not a popular opinion to take, but some less pessimistic sections of the Arsenal support (think there are still one or two knocking about) will tell you that the club is actually in better shape than ever – the only problem is that so is everyone else. Arsenal are currently winning more than the Invincibles (Picture: Getty) 
Wenger had a far more successful first half of his reign than second, but until 2003 he only had Manchester United to contend with in the Premier League. Everything changed when Roman Abramovich bought Chelsea, and since then there has also been significant cash pumped into Manchester City, while Tottenham are also hugely improved. 
According to findings by Opta’s Orbinho , Arsenal have actually managed to achieve win percentages up there with the best sides in their history three times in the last four seasons. 
Arsenal’s best ever record was 66% all the way back in 1930/31, followed closely by 65% in their double-winning year of 2001/02. Best-ever Arsenal win % (all comps) 1930/31
